snippet: Many more could drown unless immigration restrictions are relaxed and doors are opened.
abstract: Editorial urges Europe to reform its policies on migration, warning 2015 may become deadliest year on record for African and Middle Eastern migrants attempting to cross Mediterranean for Europe; notes deaths of approximately 900 people after ship bound from Libya capsizes; contends European Union's humanitarian values require that all 28 member states support and finance reforms and share burden of hosting migrants.
lead_paragraph: Many more could drown unless immigration restrictions are relaxed and doors are opened.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
